text: Doris Leon "D. L." MenardFrançois 1990, p. 446. (April 14, 1932 – July 27, 2017) was an American singer-songwriter and guitarist in contemporary Cajun music. He was called the "Cajun Hank Williams." He was born in Erath, Louisiana. In 2010, his album Happy Go Lucky was nominated for a Grammy Award in the Best Zydeco or Cajun music album category. Menard died on July 27, 2017 in Scott, Louisiana of a heart attack at the age of 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1932 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American guitarists Category:Musicians from Louisiana Category:Singers from Louisiana Category:Writers from Louisiana
title: D. L. Menard
